creatures.name: Vampire
creatures.description: In contemporary tales, vampires are depicted as pale, gaunt beings, obsessed with either reveling in or mourning their loss of humanity. Classically, these tragic beings were described as having a ruddy complex, with flushed cheeks and lips and a slightly swollen belly.
creatures.diet: Vampires drink human blood, usually while their victim is either asleep or enthralled in a trance-like state.

creatures.name: Ogopogo
creatures.description: Ogopogo is a large aquatic serpent supposedly living in Canada's Okanagan Lake in British Columbia. Sightings are scattered, and photographic evidence rare.
creatures.diet: Ogopogo, like most aquatic carnivores, has a diet of fish and other aquatic animals. It is unknown if it consumes humans.

creatures.name: Capelobo
creatures.description: The capelobo is said to have 2 forms, one humanoid, and one more animal-like. In animal form, the capelobo appears to be a tapir with certain dog-like attributes. In humanoid form, this creatures takes on its more dangerous appearance. Armed with sharp claws, the head of a tapir (sometimes a dog or anteater), and thick fur coat, the capelobo is more than capable of hunting its chosen prey.
creatures.diet: The capelobo eats newborn kittens or puppies, and will squeeze the blood out of a human before consuming their brain.

creatures.name: Chupacabra
creatures.description: A mexican crypid whose name translates to 'goat-sucker', the chupacabra is described as both reptilian and canine in appearance. Roughly the size of a large dog or small bear, the chupacabra hunts at night.
creatures.diet: As stated by its name, the chupacabra eats by draining the blood of goats and other livestock.

creatures.name: Mongolian Death Worm
creatures.description: The death worm is shaped like a sausage about two feet long, has no head nor leg and it is so poisonous that merely to touch it means instant death.
creatures.diet: The worm is a carnivore, rarely breaching the surface of the desert except to feed.

creatures.name: Mothman
creatures.description: First spotted in Mount Pleasant, the mothman is said to be an omen of misfortune. It is described as being a slender man, roughly seven feet tall, with glowing red eyes and dark wings.
creatures.diet: No information about the mothman's diet is known, though assumptions based upon its humanoid appearance can be made.

creatures.name: Upiór
creatures.description: The upiór is often described as a proto-vampire in that, while older chronologically, it shares many characteristics with vampires. Prior to their death, an upiór was typically a person who was ostracized by their community for being 'other' (religiously or physically). Women who died in childbirth and those who passed without last rites were also prime candidates.
creatures.diet: Like vampires, the upiór is said to drain its victims of blood. In addition, upiórs used their superhuman strength to tear their victims to shreds.

creatures.name: Mare
creatures.description: Mares are night-bound creatures often attributed with causing nightmares, hence the name. It is said they would 'ride' their victims, causing extreme exhaustion and even seizures. Mares were most commonly invoked by witches as tools of revenge.
creatures.diet: Because mares do not have a physical form, their diet is unusual. Rather that feasting on flesh or blood, mares feast on negativity and fear.

creatures.name: Jersey Devil
creatures.description: The creature is often described as a flying biped with hooves, but there are many variations. The common description is that of a bipedal kangaroo-like or wyvern-like creature with a horse- or goat-like head, leathery bat-like wings, horns, small arms with clawed hands, legs with cloven hooves, and a forked or pointed tail. It is also said that it has a strange elongated body and a thick tail. It has been reported to move quickly and is often described as emitting a high-pitched "blood-curdling scream".
creatures.diet: The jersey devil is omnivorous, raiding farms to devour crops and livestock alike.

creatures.name: Pope Lick Monster
creatures.description: More commonly known as the goat man, the Pope Lick monster lives under a trestle bridge in Louisville, Kentucky.  Numerous urban legends exist about the creature's origins and the methods it employs to claim its victims. According to some accounts, the creature uses either hypnosis or voice mimicry to lure trespassers onto the trestle to meet their death before an oncoming train. Other stories claim the monster jumps down from the trestle onto the roofs of cars passing beneath it. Yet other legends tell that it attacks its victims with a blood-stained axe and that the very sight of the creature is so unsettling that those who see it while walking across the high trestle are driven to leap off.  Other legends hold that the monster is a human-goat hybrid, and that it was a circus freak who vowed revenge after being mistreated. In one version, it is said the monster escaped after a train derailed on the trestle. Another version commonly told by locals of the area claims that the monster is really the twisted reincarnated form of a farmer who sacrificed goats in exchange for Satanic powers.
creatures.diet: Although nothing is reported, the pope lick monster can be assumed to have an omnivorous diet.

creatures.name: Deer Man
creatures.description: Deer Man is a cryptid whose legend originates in the folklore of North America. A hybrid animal, Deer Man has the antlered head of a great stag, a human's torso, and legs described as similar to either those of a man or deer. In addition, it is usually said to be well muscled, and surprisingly fast for its size. Other accounts gift the beast with the power to transform itself from a regular deer into the form described previously.
creatures.diet: Although, as with most cryptids, a definitive diet is unknown, the deer-man bears close resemblance to Navajo skinwalkers. As such, a carnivorous diet of human flesh can be assumed.

creatures.name: Daeva
creatures.description: A daeva is a being that was 'born to be rejected. That is, an entity of chaos and destruction.
creatures.diet: Being ephemeral creatures of shadow, ,daeva's do not have a diet.

users.name: Zavier Hopson
users.bio: Created this website to bring together all the monster hunters, lovers, and enthusiasts.
